data.title: The Stillwater Newspress
data.meta_description: Larry Borgelt passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the The Stillwater Newspress on 2011-08-05.
data.text:
Larry Borgelt, MS, CSP, PE Private services were held July 26 for Larry Borgelt, PE, CSP. He was born in Dodge City, Kan., on Oct. 27, 1939, the son of Harold and Ethel Borgelt of Zenda Kansas. He is survived by his wife, Jacqelyn, son, Andrew, two sisters, Lana Helm and Linda Swingle, and brother, Leland. He served in the Army then attended Oklahoma State University completing an AD in Fire Science, a BS in Physical Sciences and an MS in Trade and Industrial Education. He worked for Lockheed Martin, taught fire protection, then joined the School of Fire Protection, Oklahoma State University in Stillwater retiring as a Professor of Fire Protection and Safety Engineering. In retirement he became an avid scouting volunteer focusing on shooting sports and horsemanship. He was a life member of the National Fire Protection Association. Donations may be made to: Heart of America Council Endowment – Shooting Sports 10210 Holmes Road, Kansas City MO 64131, and Oklahoma State Foundation –RJ Douglas Scholarship, in care of Dr. M. Larranaga, SFP & Safety, 499 Cordell S. OSU, Stillwater, OK 74078.

Published on August 5, 2011

Plant a Living Memorial

Send Flowers: When Is the Ordering Deadline?

Next-Day Delivery

ANY DAY OF THE WEEK

Order any time up till the day before

Same-Day Delivery

MON-FRI Order by 2:00PM

SAT & SUN Order by noon

Morning Delivery

TUES-SAT Order by 3:00PM

The day before

SAT & SUN Order by Saturday

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentine’s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
